tasks_output.description:
Analyze the travel insurance call transcript below and extract key customer requirements.
Step 1: Read the transcript carefully and extract all relevant details. For each field in the schema, provide a brief annotation or reference to the specific portion(s) of the transcript where the detail was found.
Step 2: Review your annotations to verify that every extracted detail directly matches the transcript. Resolve any discrepancies or conflicts in the data.
Step 3: Produce a final, validated JSON object that adheres exactly to the TravelInsuranceRequirement schema

If a field is not mentioned in the transcript, use null.

Transcript:
Customer Service Agent: Good morning, thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. My name is Siti, how may I help you today?
Customer: Morning Siti! Oh, finally got through, the line was busy just now, maybe everyone planning holidays eh? I'm calling about travel insurance for an upcoming trip. So exciting! Haven't travelled much since the whole C-word situation, you know? Trying to make up for lost time lah!
Customer Service Agent: Yes, it's definitely getting busy again! I understand you'd like to inquire about travel insurance. To help me understand your needs better, could you please share where you'll be travelling to?
Customer: Ah yes! We're planning a trip to Australia! Me and my buddy, Kenneth. He's my kaki for golf, you know? We're heading down under, hoping to hit some famous courses. Haven't been to Aussie in ages, last time was probably... oh, must be 10 years ago for my cousin's wedding in Perth. Lovely time, but rained quite a bit. Hope the weather is better this time for golf!
Customer Service Agent: Australia sounds wonderful, especially for golf. And how long will you and Kenneth be travelling for?
Customer: We're planning for about 10 days. Enough time to get a few rounds in, see some sights, maybe catch up with another old friend who moved to Melbourne. He keeps telling me how good the coffee is there, better than Singapore he says! I told him, "Eh, don't say until you try the kopi C kosong near my place!" *laughs*
Customer Service Agent: Ten days in Australia, noted. And you mentioned there will be two of you travelling?
Customer: Yes, just the two of us old birds escaping our wives for a bit! *chuckles* Just joking... mostly! Kenneth is great company, solid golfer too, though I usually beat him. Don't tell him I said that!
Customer Service Agent: Alright, two travellers. And could you let me know which age group you both fall into? Is it 18-25, 26-40, 41-55, 56-65, or 65+? This helps determine the right plan details.
Customer: Aiyah, have to ask that question ah? Okay lah, okay lah... we're comfortably in the 41-55 bracket. Closer to the 55 end, but spirit still young, okay! Still can whack the golf ball quite far!
Customer Service Agent: Noted, 41-55 age group. And you'll be travelling from Singapore, correct?
Customer: Yes, correct. Flying out from Changi. Best airport in the world, right? Though sometimes the walk to the gate feels like a marathon already! Need to be fit even before the holiday starts.
Customer Service Agent: It can be quite a walk! Now, thinking about your trip, what are some of the things you want to make sure are covered? Any particular concerns you have when travelling?
Customer: Oh ya, definitely. You know lah, at our age, cannot play play. Getting sick overseas is one big worry. Imagine kena appendicitis or something in the middle of nowhere? The hospital bills confirm chop carrot, right? So good medical coverage is a must. Need to make sure doctor visits, hospital stays, all that are covered just in case. Touch wood, of course!
Customer Service Agent: Okay, so ensuring comprehensive medical coverage for emergencies is important for you.
Customer: Yes, very important. And then there's the usual stuff, like luggage. My goodness, last time Kenneth flew somewhere, can't remember where, his whole suitcase went missing for three days! He had to buy all new clothes. Total disaster! So coverage for lost or damaged bags is definitely needed. You know, reimbursement if the airline loses it, or if it arrives looking like an elephant sat on it. And maybe something if it's delayed also? Need to buy essentials mah.
Customer Service Agent: Understood, coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed baggage is a requirement.
Customer: Exactly! And what about flight delays? You know how it is sometimes, stuck at the airport for hours. Last time I was stuck in Hong Kong overnight because of a typhoon. Cost a bomb for the hotel! So some coverage for extra accommodation or meals if the flight gets seriously delayed would be good.
Customer Service Agent: Alright, cover for significant travel delays causing extra expenses like accommodation and meals.
Customer: Yes, precisely. And one more thing... heaven forbid, but what if something happens just before we leave? Like if one of us falls seriously ill, or maybe a family emergency back home forces us to cancel the whole trip? All the bookings, flights, hotels... gone just like that. So, trip cancellation coverage is important too, for those unforeseen emergencies. Don't want the money to just go down the drain, you know?
Customer Service Agent: Okay, trip cancellation protection for unforeseen covered events like illness or emergencies is needed.
Customer: Perfect! Now... the main event! Golf! This is the big one, Siti. It's a proper golf trip. My clubs alone cost more than my first car, I tell you! So, I absolutely need coverage for my golf equipment if it gets lost, stolen, or damaged during transit or even while playing. Very important ah!
Customer Service Agent: Okay, noted. Coverage specifically for your golf equipment.
Customer: And also, what if, say, I fall sick halfway through the trip and can't play the rounds we've already booked and paid for? So expensive, these green fees in Australia! Can I get reimbursed for the unused green fees?
Customer Service Agent: Right, reimbursement for pre-paid, unused green fees due to unforeseen circumstances like illness.
Customer: Yes! And another thing, you know those golf buggies? Sometimes the courses are hilly lah. What if, touch wood again, I accidentally scratch it or dent it? Does the insurance cover damage to the rented golf buggy? Kenneth is a bit wild sometimes behind the wheel of a buggy *laughs*.
Customer Service Agent: Understood, you're asking about coverage for accidental damage caused to a rented golf buggy.
Customer: Exactly! And finally... this is the dream lah... what if I hit a hole-in-one? It's every golfer's dream! Some clubs give you a big bar tab if you hit one. Is there any kind of special benefit or payout if I manage to score a hole-in-one during the trip? Would be nice to celebrate properly, you know! My treat for Kenneth!
Customer Service Agent: Okay, so you're also interested in a special benefit for achieving a hole-in-one during your trip.
Customer: Yes! That covers the golf side of things I think. Just the usual medical, luggage, delays, cancellation, and then the specific golf protection â€“ equipment, unused green fees, buggy damage, and the hole-in-one bonus! Sounds like a lot, hope it's not too complicated? We just want peace of mind, enjoy the golf lah.
Customer Service Agent: Thank you for sharing all that detail, it's very helpful. Let me quickly summarize the key requirements you've mentioned for your 10-day trip to Australia for two travellers aged 41-55, travelling from Singapore. You need:
Customer: Yes, Siti, that sounds perfect! You got everything spot on. Wah, you're very efficient ah! Better than my memory sometimes! *laughs* It's good to list it all out like that. Peace of mind, that's the main thing.
Customer Service Agent: Excellent. Thank you for confirming those requirements. I have noted all these details down. The next step would be for our sales team to look into the plans that best match these needs and provide you with a quotation. Would you like me to arrange for someone from sales to contact you?
Customer: Oh, yes please! That would be great. Get the ball rolling, as they say! Hopefully, they have something that fits all this. Thanks so much for your help today, Siti, you've been lovely to chat with.
Customer Service Agent: You're most welcome! It was my pleasure speaking with you too. I'll put in the request for our sales team to reach out. Thank you again for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. Have a wonderful day and happy planning for your golf trip!
Customer: Thank you, Siti! You too, have a great day! Bye bye!
tasks_output.expected_output: A JSON object that matches the TravelInsuranceRequirement model.
